subject: Re: On a keyboard
msgSnippet: ... Using your image, I was able to knock out a .keylayout file for Mac OS X.  I uploaded the file and an image thereof into Resources/Read64_keylayout.zip I
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, amd64_hacker <amd64_hacker@...>
wrote:
> Well, I'm still working on getting key map, but since xkbprint won't
> parse it at the mo I've created a reference image by hand.
> I've uploaded it as xkb_qs1.png.
> I'm going to try a port of oliver langan's keymap now, I'll upload both
> keymaps + scripts when I get them working.

Using your image, I was able to knock out a .keylayout file for Mac OS
X. I uploaded the file and an image thereof into
Resources/Read64_keylayout.zip

I took the liberty of placing the QS keys on CAPS LOCK, so that the
same keyboard layout could be used for TEO (Traditional English
Orthography, as Read calls it) and QS with very little pain in
switching. I also took the liberty of putting the namer dot and some
other punctuation on the keys which you had not specified in your image.

And, speaking of layouts, I updated my own .keylayout file and
realized that I had never uploaded it. I have posted it into
Resources/ReadCaps_keylayout.zip containing the .keylayout file as
well as two images. This mostly matches the mapping I presented in
"Resources/oliver's keyboard mapping.gif" so long ago, with the
following changes:
* as with the Read64.keylayout, this is on the CAPS LOCK key to
facilitate switching back and forth.
* I changed the forward slash punctuation to a backslash, since the
former could potentially be confused with the Way character.
* I shifted all the numbers over by 1, so that they run 0-9 rather
than 1-0, because I am a geek and I think it is more logical. It will
mess you up at first: it does me.
* though I didn't specify it originally, I change the forward slash
on the keypad as well to be a proper division marker.

I know these are probably not useful to you personally, amd64 (though,
really, all hackers should have macs ;) but it will allow people who
are using macs to play with and comment on the layouts.

oliver
